{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2503.24011v1", "title": "Simulations in Statistical Workflows", "summary": "Simulations play important and diverse roles in statistical workflows, for
example, in model specification, checking, validation, and even directly in
model inference. Over the past decades, the application areas and overall
potential of simulations in statistical workflows have expanded significantly,
driven by the development of new simulation-based algorithms and exponentially
increasing computational resources. In this paper, we examine past and current
trends in the field and offer perspectives on how simulations may shape the
future of statistical practice.", "main_category": "stat.CO", "categories": "stat.CO", "published": "2025-03-31T12:38:21Z"}
